<div id="siteNotice" class="mw-body-content"><!-- CentralNotice --></div><div class="mw-indicators mw-body-content">
</div>
<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">List of largest sports contracts</h1> <div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div> <div id="contentSub"></div>
<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
Jump to: <a href="#mw-head">navigation</a>, <a href="#p-search">search</a>
</div>
<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><p>The following is a <b>list of the largest sports contracts</b>. These figures include <a href="/wiki/Signing_bonus" title="Signing bonus">signing bonuses</a> but exclude options, buyouts, and endorsement deals. This list does not reflect the highest annual salaries or career earnings, only the largest contracts and thus is limited to athletes in <a href="/wiki/Team_sports" class="mw-redirect" title="Team sports">team sports</a> and <a href="/wiki/Auto_racing" title="Auto racing">auto racing</a>. Athletes in <a href="/wiki/Individual_sport" title="Individual sport">individual sports</a>, such as <a href="/wiki/Golf" title="Golf">golf</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tennis" title="Tennis">tennis</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Boxing" title="Boxing">boxing</a> are not employed by a team and usually earn money primarily through event winnings. This list also does not necessarily reflect actual money collected by the athletes, since some contracts are eventually terminated (usually due to an athlete either retiring or invoking their opt-out clause).</p>
<p></p>
<div id="toc" class="toc">
<div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr">
<h2>Contents</h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1"><a href="#Largest_sports_contracts"><span class="tocnumber">1</span> <span class="toctext">Largest sports contracts</span></a></li>

<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-3"><a href="#Notes"><span class="tocnumber">3</span> <span class="toctext">Notes</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-4"><a href="#References"><span class="tocnumber">4</span> <span class="toctext">References</span></a></li>
</ul>
</div>
<p></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Largest_sports_contracts">Largest sports contracts</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_largest_sports_contracts&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Largest sports contracts">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<table class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders">
<tr style="text-align:center; font-weight:bold; vertical-align:bottom;">
<th>Rank</th>
<th>Player</th>
<th>Team</th>
<th>Sport</th>
<th>Length of contract</th>
<th>Contract value (<a href="/wiki/United_States_dollar" title="United States dollar">USD</a>)</th>
<th>Average per year (<a href="/wiki/United_States_dollar" title="United States dollar">USD</a>)</th>
<th>Average per game<sup>5</sup> (<a href="/wiki/United_States_dollar" title="United States dollar">USD</a>)</th>
<th>Ref<sup id="cite_ref-Brown_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brown-1">[1]</a></sup></th>
</tr>

<td>01</td>
<td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><a href="/wiki/Giancarlo_Stanton" title="Giancarlo Stanton">Giancarlo Stanton</a></td>
<td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><a href="/wiki/Miami_Marlins" title="Miami Marlins">Miami Marlins</a></td>
<td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><a href="/wiki/Baseball" title="Baseball">Baseball</a></td>
<td style="vertical-align:bottom;">13 years (2014-2027)</td>
<td style="text-align:right; vertical-align:bottom;">$325,000,000</td>
<td style="text-align:right; vertical-align:bottom;">$25,000,000</td>
<td style="text-align:right; vertical-align:bottom;">$154,320.99</td>

<p><i><sup>1</sup> â€“ Rodriguez's 2014 salary was reduced to $2,868,853 due to his season-long suspension related to the <a href="/wiki/Biogenesis_baseball_scandal" title="Biogenesis baseball scandal">Biogenesis baseball scandal</a><sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">[129]</a></sup><br /></i> <i><sup>2</sup> â€“ Rodriguez opted out of this contract after the 2007 season<br /></i> <i><sup>3</sup> â€“ Vick's contract was terminated by the Atlanta Falcons after the 2006 season<br /></i> <i><sup>4</sup> â€“ Arenas was suspended without pay for the majority of the 2009-10 season<br /></i> <i><sup>5</sup> â€“ Based on regular season games only (excludes any playoff games), also in baseball, starting pitchers usually pitch every five games, resting during the interval between starts<br /></i> <i><sup>6</sup> - Exact contract figures will be available once the 2017â€“18 salary cap is set and contracts are officially signed<br /></i> <i><sup>R</sup> â€“ retired<br /></i> <i><sup>Injury</sup> - While still technically under contract, injury has ended his career<br /></i> <i>* â€“ no longer on team</i><br />
<i>â€¡ â€“ entirety of contract salary not guaranteed</i></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_largest_sports_contracts&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: See also">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Gaius_Appuleius_Diocles" title="Gaius Appuleius Diocles">Gaius Appuleius Diocles</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/List_of_highest_paid_baseball_players" class="mw-redirect" title="List of highest paid baseball players">List of highest paid baseball players</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_association_football_transfers" title="List of most expensive association football transfers">List of most expensive association football transfers</a></li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_largest_sports_contracts&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Notes">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul>
<li>Contracts in the NFL are often not guaranteed, meaning that players who retire, or who are cut, do not receive their contracted salaries after their release from the team.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/NBA" class="mw-redirect" title="NBA">NBA</a> and <a href="/wiki/NHL" class="mw-redirect" title="NHL">NHL</a> seasons span two calendar years.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Michael_Vick" title="Michael Vick">Michael Vick</a> was suspended by the <a href="/wiki/NFL" class="mw-redirect" title="NFL">NFL</a> in 2007. The <a href="/wiki/Atlanta_Falcons" title="Atlanta Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a> were unsuccessful in a civil legal process to attempt to recoup $20 million of the $100 million in bonuses paid to Vick under terms of his contract extension.</li>
<li>During his contract years, <a href="/wiki/Michael_Schumacher" title="Michael Schumacher">Michael Schumacher</a> had significantly higher annual earnings than the athletes on this list with larger total contracts. On top of his $31 million per year paid by the <a href="/wiki/Ferrari" title="Ferrari">Ferrari</a> team, which alone ranked as the highest annual earnings at the time, he also earned a significant amount more per year from race winnings.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a> signed a five-year deal with <a href="/wiki/Major_League_Soccer" title="Major League Soccer">MLS</a> <a href="/wiki/Soccer" class="mw-redirect" title="Soccer">soccer</a> team <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles_Galaxy" class="mw-redirect" title="Los Angeles Galaxy">Los Angeles Galaxy</a> that was worth a reported $251 million,<sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130">[130]</a></sup> but that figure included commercial endorsements; only $5 million a year of that figure is salary from the club, while the rest will come via existing endorsements and profit sharing with the club.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131">[131]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-132">[132]</a></sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Lewis_Hamilton" title="Lewis Hamilton">Lewis Hamilton</a> signed a contract with <a href="/wiki/McLaren_Mercedes" class="mw-redirect" title="McLaren Mercedes">McLaren Mercedes</a> worth at least â‚¤70 million ($138 million <a href="/wiki/United_States_Dollar" class="mw-redirect" title="United States Dollar">USD</a>) over 5 seasons (2008â€“2012). However, no official contract details have been released by the team.<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-133">[133]</a></sup></li>
<li>In 2010, the NHL rejected a 17-year, $102 million contract between the <a href="/wiki/New_Jersey_Devils" title="New Jersey Devils">New Jersey Devils</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ilya_Kovalchuk" title="Ilya Kovalchuk">Ilya Kovalchuk</a>, saying that the contract was "a circumvention of the <a href="/wiki/Collective_bargaining_agreement" class="mw-redirect" title="Collective bargaining agreement">collective bargaining agreement</a>." The later years of the contract would have paid Kovalchuk only $550,000 per year, which lowered the average value per year of the contract. (The <a href="/wiki/NHL_Salary_Cap" class="mw-redirect" title="NHL Salary Cap">NHL's salary cap</a> is based on the average value per year.) <sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-134">[134]</a></sup></li>
<li class="mw-empty-elt"></li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_largest_sports_contracts&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="reflist columns references-column-width" style="-moz-column-width: 30em; -webkit-column-width: 30em; column-width: 30em; list-style-type: decimal;">

<li id="cite_note-128"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-128">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/53/celeb-100-10_Cristiano-Ronaldo_IE35.html">"The 2010 Celebrity 100: #48 Cristiano Ronaldo"</a>. Forbes.com. 2010-06-28<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2014-08-29</span></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=The+2010+Celebrity+100%3A+%2348+Cristiano+Ronaldo&amp;rft.date=2010-06-28&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.forbes.com%2Flists%2F2010%2F53%2Fceleb-100-10_Cristiano-Ronaldo_IE35.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+largest+sports+contracts" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-129"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-129">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Hoch, Bryan (2014-02-07). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://newyork.yankees.mlb.com/news/article/nyy/alex-rodriguez-ends-litigation-against-major-league-baseball-players-union?ymd=20140207&amp;content_id=67549260&amp;vkey=news_nyy">"A-Rod ends litigation against MLB, MLBPA"</a>. Yankees.com<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2014-03-08</span></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=A-Rod+ends+litigation+against+MLB%2C+MLBPA&amp;rft.pub=Yankees.com&amp;rft.date=2014-02-07&amp;rft.aulast=Hoch&amp;rft.aufirst=Bryan&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnewyork.yankees.mlb.com%2Fnews%2Farticle%2Fnyy%2Falex-rodriguez-ends-litigation-against-major-league-baseball-players-union%3Fymd%3D20140207%26content_id%3D67549260%26vkey%3Dnews_nyy&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+largest+sports+contracts" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-130"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-130">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/ABC_News" title="ABC News">ABC News</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://abcnews.go.com/GMA/story?id=2786923">Beckham Looking Forward to U.S. Challenge</a>. January 12, 2007. Retrieved January 26, 2008.</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-131"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-131">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070125033823/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2007/soccer/01/11/bc.soccer.beckham.contract/">"Entertainment value"</a>. <i>Article on si.com</i>. 2007-01-11. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2007/soccer/01/11/bc.soccer.beckham.contract/?">the original</a> on 25 January 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">11 January</span> 2007</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Article+on+si.com&amp;rft.atitle=Entertainment+value&amp;rft.date=2007-01-11&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fsportsillustrated.cnn.com%2F2007%2Fsoccer%2F01%2F11%2Fbc.soccer.beckham.contract%2F%3F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+largest+sports+contracts" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-132"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-132">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web">Chang, Jen. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://soccernet.espn.go.com/columns/story?id=399597&amp;root=mls&amp;cc=5901">"Debunking the myths behind Beckham's contract"</a>. <i>ESPN Soccernet</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 January</span> 2007</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=ESPN+Soccernet&amp;rft.atitle=Debunking+the+myths+behind+Beckham%27s+contract&amp;rft.aulast=Chang&amp;rft.aufirst=Jen&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fsoccernet.espn.go.com%2Fcolumns%2Fstory%3Fid%3D399597%26root%3Dmls%26cc%3D5901&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+largest+sports+contracts" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-133"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-133">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news">Gorman, Edward (11 March 2008). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/formula_1/article3523351.ece">"Lewis Hamilton saving for a rainy day"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Times" title="The Times">The Times</a></i>. London<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">10 March</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Lewis+Hamilton+saving+for+a+rainy+day&amp;rft.date=2008-03-11&amp;rft.aulast=Gorman&amp;rft.aufirst=Edward&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.timesonline.co.uk%2Ftol%2Fsport%2Fformula_1%2Farticle3523351.ece&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+largest+sports+contracts" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>

Rejects Long-Term Contract for Devils' Ilya Kovalchuk"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=N.H.L.+Rejects+Long-Term+Contract+for+Devils%27+Ilya+Kovalchuk&amp;rft.date=2010-07-21&amp;rft.aulast=Caldwell&amp;rft.aufirst=Dave&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2010%2F07%2F22%2Fsports%2Fhockey%2F22devils.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+largest+sports+contracts" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
